para.title: TRANSMISSION OIL SEAL REPLACEMENT PROCEDURES FOR UNITIZED SEALS

warning.para: To prevent serious eye injury, always wear safe eye protection when you perform vehicle maintenance or service.

caution.para: Use only the specified seal driver tool (Meritor tool number 3256-Z-1014-A; SPX Kent-Moore tool number J-39161-A) to install the seal. Any other seal driver will not install the seal to the correct depth and can damage the seal.

note.para: Order the unitized seal and seal driver used in this procedure by calling Meritor Aftermarket Services at 888-725-9355. Order the seal driver and flange/yoke holding tool from SPX Kent-Moore at 800-328-6657.

step1.para: Disconnect the driveshaft from the output yoke. Support the driveshaft.
Secure the yoke with a flange/yoke holding tool (SPX Kent-Moore tool number J-3453). Refer to Figure 1.
Place a 3-3/4-inch socket on the output shaft yoke retaining nut. Remove the nut. Refer to Figure 1.

note.para: You must replace the output shaft seal whenever you remove the yoke.

step1.para: Remove the yoke from the output shaft ( Figure 2).
If the unitized seal inner ring comes off with the yoke, remove it from the yoke. Discard the seal.
Remove the speedometer tooth wheel or the drive gear from the yoke.
Use a seal puller to remove the output shaft seal from the retainer. Discard the seal ( Figure 3).
Position the new output shaft seal on the seal driver tool so that the seal flange lies flat against the tool surface ( Figure 4).

caution.para: The seal flange must rest flush against the retainer. The seal can leak if gaps exist between the seal flange and retainer. Damage to components can result.

step1.para: Use the seal driver to drive the seal into the retainer until the seal flange rests flush against the retainer ( Figure 5 and Figure 6).
Inspect the yoke for wear or damage. Replace the yoke when the journal is rusted, burred or nicked.

Lightly lubricate the splines and the outer diameter of the yoke with the specified transmission oil. Refer to Meritor's technical bulletin Transmission Lubricant Specifications. To order a copy of this bulletin contact Meritor's Customer Service Center at 800-535-5560 and request TP-90114.
Install the speedometer tooth wheel or drive gear.
Install the yoke onto the output shaft. Use a flange/yoke holding tool to secure the yoke.
Install the output shaft yoke retaining nut ( Figure 7).

caution.para: You must tighten the output shaft yoke retaining nut to the specified torque. Do not tighten the output shaft yoke retaining nut beyond 500 ft-lbs. (677 Nm). Damage to the output bearing can result.

step1.para: Use a torque wrench to tighten the output shaft yoke retaining nut to 450-500 ft-lbs. (610-677 Nm) ( Figure 1).
Check the transmission oil level. The oil level must be even with the bottom of the fill plug hole. Adjust the oil level as necessary.
Connect the driveshaft to the output yoke.
Install and tighten the fasteners according to the vehicle manufacturer's specifications.
